theses.name: AI Infrastructure Buildout: Power, Semiconductors, and Data Centers
theses.description: Data centers need 175%+ additional power by 2030, semiconductor capacity is sold out 12+ months ahead, and data center vacancy rates hit record lows of 1.6%. Infrastructure investments are transitioning from discretionary spending to critical national security assets as AI deployment accelerates across developed and emerging markets.

theses.name: European Defense & Economic Security Paradigm Shift
theses.description: Europe's defense sector transitions from sluggish undervalued market to central government policy focus. NATO commitment to 5% of GDP defense spending by 2035, Germany's fiscal package could increase spending by â‚¬80bn (1.8% of GDP) in 2026. Old paradigm of US defense dependence shifts to new paradigm of increased defense spending and fiscal stimulus.

theses.name: Global Supply Chain Resilience & Onshoring
theses.description: Economic fragmentation drives fundamental shift toward resilience, security, and regional alignment. Reshoring and nearshoring accelerate across North America, Europe, and Asia. Investment opportunities in sectors benefiting from supply chain reconfiguration including semiconductors, critical minerals, logistics, and manufacturing.

theses.name: Private Credit: Middle Market Opportunity in Transition
theses.description: Private credit returns expected at 5.4% in 2026 (down from 9% in 2025) as market matures. However, middle market opportunities remain attractive with $120bn expected supply, specialized niches commanding higher premiums. Energy transition sector shows significant supply/demand imbalance with only $61bn raised vs $781bn for sustainable private equity since 2014.

theses.name: Tech Concentration Unwind: Broadening Bull Market
theses.description: After years of extreme concentration, equity markets showing signs of broadening. S&P 500's top 7 stocks contribute 46% of 2026 EPS growth (down from 50% in 2025). Value stocks (financials, defense, utilities) outperforming. Small and mid-cap revival as rate cuts benefit rate-sensitive sectors and M&A activity accelerates.

theses.name: Emerging Markets: China Export Strength & India Demographics
theses.description: China demonstrates export resilience despite trade headwinds, with losses in US offset by gains in emerging markets. Technology and auto sectors showing 40%+ and 80%+ profit growth respectively. India benefits from strong GDP growth, surging digital payments (3x since 2021), and favorable demographics (65% under 35, median age 28).

theses.name: Circular Economy & Resource Efficiency
theses.description: Waste, water, and recycling sectors involve contracted essential services largely insulated from macro fluctuations. Opportunities in relatively undercapitalized middle market. Businesses converting organic waste to biomethane/fertilizer, water efficiency sensors, and environmental compliance systems gaining prominence as companies prioritize efficiency and cost savings.

theses.name: Commercial Real Estate Recovery: Quality Bifurcation
theses.description: After 3 years of muted activity, commercial real estate poised for rebound as cap rates stabilize, construction starts dropped since 2022, and transaction activity picks up. Clear bifurcation: prime assets (new, well-located, energy-efficient) vs distressed assets. Office sector under most strain ($57B distressed US) but prime CBD assets seeing 54% YoY transaction increase.

theses.name: High-Quality Fixed Income Renaissance: Bonds Are Back
theses.description: After years in the wilderness, high-quality bonds offer compelling real returns with neutral rate projected around 4% over the next decade. Bond yields reset from ~1% (2020) to 4.3% (2026) on Bloomberg US Aggregate. Vanguard research shows strongest risk-return profile is high-quality US fixed income, followed by US value equities and non-US developed markets.

theses.name: Emerging Market Debt: Hard & Local Currency Opportunities
theses.description: Weaker US dollar, lower US rates, and effective EM fiscal/monetary policy improving economic resilience. EM hard currency debt particularly attractive with overweight recommendation. Fed easing enables EM rate cuts without significant currency weakness, benefiting both external and local debt.

theses.name: Japanese Equity Revival: Reflation & Corporate Reform
theses.description: Japanese equities supported by moderating inflation, stable monetary policy, potential increased fiscal support from Takaichi government. Corporate capex and consumer spending fueled by wage growth driving earnings. Corporate governance reforms unlocking shareholder value through dividends and buybacks.

theses.name: US Deregulation Beneficiaries: Financials, Energy, Pharma
theses.description: Trump administration pursuing economic policy focused on deregulation. Potential catalysts for sectors including financials (banking reform), energy (drilling/LNG), and pharmaceuticals (FDA streamlining). Regulatory agenda becoming bigger focus as Congress turns to midterms.

theses.name: Middle East Diversification & Infrastructure
theses.description: Economic reforms alongside diversification beyond oil generating new investment opportunities across GCC countries. Themes include digitalization and infrastructure investment underpinning corporate earnings. Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and UAE largely unaffected by regional tensions.

theses.name: Climate Adaptation & Physical Risk Management
theses.description: Rising temperatures and extreme weather events driving focus on physical risk and adaptation rather than just mitigation. Investment opportunities in companies providing adaptation solutions: HVAC, water infrastructure, coastal defense, food production, disaster risk management. Insurance costs rising and infrastructure capex increasing for resilience.

theses.name: Sustainable Food & Agriculture Technology
theses.description: Sustainable food and agriculture emerging as investor focus beyond economic security and energy transition. Businesses prioritizing efficiency and cost savings through agricultural technology, precision farming, alternative proteins. Climate volatility driving need for resilient food production systems.

theses.name: Green Bonds & Sustainable Fixed Income
theses.description: Green bond market providing significant portfolio diversification without sacrificing liquidity or returns. Market continues to grow with different sector composition vs conventional fixed income, providing diversification benefits. Demand for debt financing for renewable projects creating opportunities.

theses.name: Private Equity Middle Market: Value-Add Opportunities
theses.description: Private equity showing positive outlook despite mature market. Middle market value-add infrastructure and middle market companies offer better-priced deals, negotiation flexibility, and strong exit optionality vs mega-cap space. Private equity performance can be captured through factor tilts, leverage understanding, and sector selection.

theses.name: Commodities & Base Metals: Tight Supply Meets Strong Demand
theses.description: Base metals experiencing tight supply conditions with higher demand from manufacturing, construction, and electrification. Copper critical for power infrastructure and EVs. Bank of America expects continued supply challenges in 2026 despite tepid demand from traditional sectors.

theses.name: Healthcare Innovation: AI-Enabled Biotech & Medical Technology
theses.description: Healthcare sector benefiting from AI integration in drug discovery, diagnostics, and treatment planning. Biotech innovation accelerating with AI/ML tools. Medical devices incorporating advanced technology. Aging demographics across developed markets driving healthcare demand.

theses.name: Cybersecurity & Digital Defense
theses.description: Economic security theme includes cybersecurity alongside traditional defense and energy security. Increasing capital investment in cybersecurity with growing earnings potential. Critical infrastructure protection, cloud security, and AI-powered threat detection becoming essential investments.

theses.name: Inflation Protection & TIPS
theses.description: Inflation undergoing structural shift - higher and more volatile than pre-pandemic. Maintaining purchasing power critical goal. Inflation-linked bonds offer protection. Traditional 60/40 portfolios showed increased volatility in higher inflation regime (7% pre-COVID to 12% post-COVID).

theses.name: Active ETF Revolution: Fixed Income & Private Assets
theses.description: Active ETF assets growing 46% annually since 2020, with particularly strong growth in fixed income (41% of US-listed fixed income ETF inflows). Active approach valuable for navigating structural inefficiencies. Innovation bringing private asset exposure through ETF structures.

theses.name: M&A Revival & Dealmaking Acceleration
theses.description: Global dealmaking showing strong recovery signs extending into 2026. US M&A increased significantly in 2025 vs 2024. 15% expected increase in completed US M&A deals in 2026. European M&A rebounding above historical averages. Greater dealmaking spurring private equity activity and private credit demand.

theses.name: Dollar Decline & Non-USD Opportunities
theses.description: Significant USD depreciation in 2025 driven by US policy uncertainty and increasing budget deficit. More procyclical flavor to global FX with still modestly USD bearish view. Hawkish Fed shift main risk. Non-USD investments benefiting from currency tailwinds. Particularly relevant for US-based investors.

theses.name: Tail Risk Hedging & Portfolio Protection
theses.description: Late-cycle risks and hedges important as AI impacts growth, inflation, and capex create volatility. Stock correlations fallen creating alpha opportunities but also requiring protection. Gold, volatility strategies, and equity volatility exposure providing portfolio insurance. Options strategies for downside protection.
